intro: Cicer alaicum, commonly known as the Persian vetch, is a leguminous plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its pods contain edible seeds that are used in traditional cuisines. Cicer alaicum is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil.
